main event: A reddish-white, hum-emitting object was observed by multiple witnesses, including a policeman, in Covington, Georgia in 2002.
interesting points: The object was described as maneuverable, with the ability to drift, circle, and disappear from view.
The object was estimated to be 30-35 feet in diameter and was observed for 20-25 minutes.
The object was reported to have drifted into view from the north, circled slowly in a 1-1.5 mile diameter area, and then disappeared to the west.
The object was observed at an estimated altitude of 300-1000 feet.
Multiple witnesses, including a policeman, reported seeing the object from the same general area.
witnesses: Mrs. and Mrs. Horace Holman, other residents, and a policeman
